cohortDefinitions.logicDescription:
source: O265 , 8257
hashTag: #ASSURE, #Outcome, #ASSURE-Outcome; #DrugInduced, #DME; 
submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi,
ohdsi: 
logic: Earliest event of hepatic Failure, for the 1st time in ones history, indexed on the diagnosis of Hepatic Failure. Patients are excluded if they have a diagnosis of chronic hepaticfailure any time in the past or on the same day. Also excluded patients who have otherprior liver disease such as viral hepatitis, Liver Cirrhosis, liver fibrosis, alcoholic andothers anytime prior including index. The condition is assumed to persist for 90 days.<U+200B>
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] Earliest event of Acute Hepatic Failure, with NO prior liver disease

InclusionRules.name: has no autoimmune hepatitis events in prior 'clean window' - 365 days
has no certain chronic liver disease events in prior 0 - 365 days
InclusionRules.description: Exclusion of diseases that have a similar presentation, particularly viral hepatitis, drug-induced liver injury, and alcoholic liver disease

InclusionRules.name: has no Systemic Lupus Erythematosus events in prior 0 - 365 days
InclusionRules.description: Exclusion of diseases that have a similar presentation

cohortDefinitions.logicDescription:
source: O230, 6882
hashTag: #ASSURE, #Outcome, #ASSURE-Outcome, #DME;
submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi
logic: all events of autoimmune hepatitis, indexed on diagnosis of autoimmune hepatitis, excluding event occurring in prior 365days washout period. Also excluded are events that have chronic liver diseases that may have similar presentation such as viral hepatitis, drug induced liver injury, alcoholic liver disease, and no systemic lupus erythematosus in past 365 and including index. Cohort exist is 1 day post end date.
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] All events of Autoimmune hepatitis, with a washout period of 365 days

cohortDefinitions.logicDescription:
source: O221, 9824
hashTag: #ASSURE, #Outcome, #ASSURE-Outcome, #DME;
submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi
ohdsi: https://forums.ohdsi.org/t/phenotype-submission-anaphylaxis/17835
logic: all events of anaphylaxis, indexed on diagnosis of anaphylaxis that is not due to  environmental factors. with no such events in the last 30 days. Excluded are events with diagnosis of anaphylaxis due to environmental etiology or food/substance on the say of. Also excluded are events with diagnosis or observation of insect bite or sting, accidental poisoning, or toxic effect of venom 1 day before to index date. cohort exist is 1 day post end date.
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] All events of Anaphylaxis, with NO Environmental exposures, with a washout period of 30 days

concept.CONCEPT_NAME: Infective otitis externa due to erysipelas
Allergic reaction caused by insect bite and/or insect sting

cohortDefinitions.logicDescription:
source: O220, 8623
hashTag: #ASSURE, #Outcome, #ASSURE-Outcome, #DME;
submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi
logic: All events of angioedema, indexed on a diagnosis of angioedema or urticaria followed by a diagnosis of angioedema within 3 days. With no diagnosis of angioedema in the last 180 days of washout period.  Events are excluded if they have recent cardiac edema, cellulitis, erysipelas, dermatitis or eczema, lymphedema or insect bites 7 days before to and including index date. Cohort exist is 1 day post cohort end date,
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] All events of Angioedema, with a washout period of 180 days

logic: all events of Long QT or QT prolonged. indexed on diagnosis of Long QT syndrome or QT prolonged. Excluding events of Long QT syndrome or QT prolonged occurring in the past 180 days washout period. Also excluded are events with congenital QT syndrome at any time. Cohort exist 7 days post cohort end date.
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] All events of Long QT Syndrome or QT prolonged (Acquired), with a washout period of 180 days

InclusionRules.name: Washout period of 365 days
InclusionRules.description: This rule will prevent a person to renter for 1 year after entering a cohort. This is based on the assumption that any event in the 1 year period after prior event is part of an ongoing episode of care and thus not an independent event or case.

InclusionRules.name: Should have Acute Pancreatitis within 1 day
InclusionRules.description: Includes unspecified pancreatitis code without descendants

InclusionRules.name: Should NOT have Chronic Pancreatitis on or before Acute Pancreatitis
InclusionRules.description: Includes index date.

InclusionRules.name: Should NOT have Hereditary Pancreatitis any time
InclusionRules.description: Any time in persons observation period

Intestinal ischemia including acute mesenteric ischemia

InclusionRules.name: Washout period of 365 days
InclusionRules.description: This rule will prevent a person to renter for 1 year after entering a cohort. This is based on the assumption that any event in the 1 year period after prior event is part of an ongoing episode of care and thus not an independent event or case.

InclusionRules.name: Should have Acute Pancreatitis within 1 day
InclusionRules.description: Includes unspecified pancreatitis code without descendants

InclusionRules.name: Should NOT have Chronic Pancreatitis on or before Acute Pancreatitis
InclusionRules.description: Includes index date.

InclusionRules.name: Should NOT have Hereditary Pancreatitis any time
InclusionRules.description: Any time in persons observation period

InclusionRules.name: Should NOT have Alcoholic Pancreatitis on or before Acute Pancreatitis
Should NOT have evidence Alcoholism or Severe Alcohol related disorders in past 1 year
Should NOT have evidence Alcohol intoxication in past 30 days
Should NOT have evidence Cholangitis or Cholecystitis in past 1 year
Should NOT have evidence Biliary Tract Disease in past in past 1 year
Should NOT have evidence of recent Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography
InclusionRules.description: Does not include day 0 because it may represent treatment

InclusionRules.name: Should NOT have evidence of Intestinal ischemia including acute mesenteric ischemia
Should NOT have evidence of Gastrointestinal perforation
Should NOT have evidence of Intestinal Obstruction

cohortDefinitions.logicDescription:
source: O253, 10242
hashTag: #ASSURE, #Outcome, #ASSURE-Outcome;#DrugInduced, #DME;
submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi
ohdsi: https://forums.ohdsi.org/t/phenotype-submission-acute-pancreatitis-and-drug-induced-acute-pancreatitis/17848
logic: all events of acute pancreatitis, indexed on an inpatient or emergency or an out patient visit (restricted to overlapping with an Emergency room procedures) with a diagnosis of Acute pancreatitis. With 1. no such events in prior washout window of 365 days 2. and no history of chronic pancreatitis any time prior or hereditary pancreatitis any time pre or post index.  Also excluded are events with other explanations for acute pancreatitis such as alcoholic pancreatitis, severe alcoholism, recent alcohol intoxication, cholangitis or cholecystitis, biliary tract disease, endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography, intestinal ischemia or obstruction.
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] All events Acute pancreatitis, with No chronic or hereditary or common causes of pancreatitis

InclusionRules.name: Washout - no prior vision loss in 365 days prior

submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi
ohdsi: pending
logic: all events of Vision Loss, indexed on diagnosis of Vision Loss. With 1. no such events in prior washout window of 365 days 2. and no history of other pathologically eye disease such as glaucoma, infections and others in 365 days to 1 day prior index. cohort exits is 90 days after cohort end date.
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] All events of Sudden Vision Loss, with no eye pathology causes, with a washout period of 365d

InclusionRules.name: Washout period with no AKI codes - 30 days
InclusionRules.description: To rule out diagnosis codes that are follow ups (for example: check for status of recovery or progression, check sequelae, etc) from the actual event of AKI

InclusionRules.name: No ESKD at baseline
InclusionRules.description: To exclude cases with a diagnosis of End-Stage Kidney Disease in the 365 days before AKI occurrence. Period from -365 to -7 to account for ESKD due to the index episode of AKI

InclusionRules.name: No chronic dialysis at baseline (-365 to 8 days)
InclusionRules.description: To exclude all patients receiving chronic dialysis defined as more than 3 recorded events of dialysis in the 1 year- 8 days before index date, or one erythropoietin dose and dialysis in same year

InclusionRules.name: No Kidney Transplant any time prior

cohortDefinitions.logicDescription:
source: O267, 9248
hashTag: #ASSURE, #Outcome, #ASSURE-Outcome, #DME;
submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi
ohdsi: pending
logic: All events of Acute Kidney Injury (AKI) indexed on a diagnosis of Acute kidney injury  or a Dialysis procedure at a medicare certified esrd facility for acute kidney injury without esrd. Requiring that patients have a diagnosis of prior kidney disease, any time prior including index. Excluding events/patients with 1. a diagnosis of End-Stage Kidney Disease in the 365 days before AKI occurrence 2. patients receiving chronic dialysis defined as more than 3 recorded events of dialysis in 365 days before AKI occurrence 3.  kidney Transplant any time prior ; applying a washout period of 30 days between observed repeated entry events . patients exit the cohort 7 days post end of  index.
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] All events of Acute Kidney Injury (AKI), with prior chronic kidney disease, 30d washout period

source: O207, 10219
hashTag: #ASSURE, #Outcome, #ASSURE-Outcome, #DME;
submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi
ohdsi: https://forums.ohdsi.org/t/phenotype-submission-acquired-pure-red-cell-aplasia/17854
logic: Earliest event of acquired pure red cell aplasia, indexed on diagnosis of acquired pure red cell aplasia or anemia (by diagnosis or measurement). Excluding 1. patients with congenital or genetic anemia or constitutional aplasia (all days before to 7 days after index)  2. erroneous measurements such as normal hemoglobin or hematocrit or polycythemia on the day of index  or 3. have bone marrow transplantation in the last 180 days (not including index). Cohort exist is the end of observation period.

submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi
logic: all events of Immune Thrombocytopenia (ITP), excluding such events in prior 365 days as washout period, also excluded are 1. events with a diagnosis of congenital or genetic thrombocytopenia all time prior to 7 days post index, 2. Events with a platelet count of >100 or a diagnosis of thrombocytosis on day of index 3. Events with co-occurring neutropenia, pancytopenia, bone marrow involvement, anemia 7 days within index. Persons exit after 180 days or when a normal platelet count measure is observed.
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] All events of Isolated Immune Thrombocytopenia (ITP), with a washout period of 365 days

source: O218, 10182

submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi
logic: All events of rhabdomyolysis, indexed on a diagnosis or an observation of of Rhabdomyolysis or Myoglobinuria or a diagnosis of Muscle, ligament and fascia disorders co-occurring with a measurement of creatine kinase that is 5 times above the normal range- within 7 days.  With no such events in the last 180 days washout period.  Restricted to events that overlap with an inpatient visit. Events are excluded if they had recent trauma such as burn, drowning, hypothermia, hyperthermia, hyperpyrexia, crush syndrome, sepsis, march myoglobinuria, exertional rhabdomyolysis  or alcohol intoxication, in the last 14 days including index. cohort exit 3 days post end date.
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] All events Rhabdomyolysis, with IP visit, No injury or alcohol intoxication, 180 days washout

logic: All events of neutropenia indexed on diagnosis or lab results. Excluding 1. events with congenital or genetic neutropenia all days pre to 7 days post index. 2. events with normal neutrophil count or a diagnosis of Neutrophilia on index. or 3. events with co-occurring other cell lines blood disorders (such as anemia, pancytopenia, or thrombocytopenia) 7 days pre to 7 days post index. Patients exit 21 days post end date or with the occurrence of a normal neutrophil count  Reoccurring events for the same patients will be combined into event eras if they are within 365 days of each other.

cohortDefinitions.logicDescription:
source: O216, 8686
hashTag: #ASSURE, #Outcome, #ASSURE-Outcome, #DME;
submitter: Gowtham A. Rao, Azza A Shoaibi
logic: All events of Immune Thrombocytopenia (ITP), excluding such events in prior 365 days as washout period, also excluded are 1. events with a diagnosis of congenital or genetic thrombocytopenia all time prior to 7 days post index, 2. Events with a platelet count of >100 or a diagnosis of thrombocytosis on day of index 3. Events with co-occurring neutropenia, pancytopenia, bone marrow involvement, anemia 7 days within index, 4. Events with diagnosis of common causes of thrombocytopenia including hypersplenism, antiphospholipid syndrome, paroxysmal noctural hemoglobinuria, hemolytic uremic syndrome, thrombotic microangiopathy, major autoimmune disorders, chronic liver disease, pregnancy HELLP, tumors of hematopoietic cells or nutritional deficiency- all time prior to 7 days post index. Persons exit after 180 days or when a normal platelet count measure is observe.
cohortDefinitions.name: [PL] All events of Isolated Immune Thrombocytopenia (ITP), with NO common thrombocytopenia cause

InclusionRules.name: No ESKD at baseline
InclusionRules.description: To exclude cases with a diagnosis of End-Stage Kidney Disease in the 365 days before AKI occurrence. Period from -365 to -7 to account for ESKD due to the index episode of AKI

InclusionRules.name: No chronic dialysis at baseline (-365 to 8 days)
InclusionRules.description: To exclude all patients receiving chronic dialysis defined as more than 3 recorded events of dialysis in the 1 year- 8 days before index date, or one erythropoietin dose and dialysis in same year
